DOC.brief_summary: This study design answer question whether sympathetic nervous system important determinant bone metabolism human .
DOC.brief_title: Dose Response Receptor Selectivity Beta-blocker Effects Bone Metabolism
DOC.detailed_description: In postmenopausal woman , increase sympathetic outflow , test hypothesis treatment low dose non-selective β-blocker ( propranolol ) increase serum marker bone formation reduce marker bone resorption ( Aim 1a ) ; use increasingly β1-AR selective blocker ( atenolol nebivolol ) , good define β-adrenergic receptor selectivity ( β1 versus β2 ) regulation bone turnover sympathetic outflow human .
DOC.criteria: least 5 yr since last menses Follicle Stimulating Hormone ( FSH ) > 20 IU/L Abnormality screen laboratory study Presence significant liver renal disease Malignancy ( include myeloma ) Malabsorption Diabetes Hypoparathyroidism Hyperparathyroidism Acromegaly Cushing 's syndrome Hypopituitarism Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease Undergoing treatment medication affect bone turnover , include follow : adrenocorticosteroids ( > 3 month time > 10 day within previous yr ) anticonvulsant therapy ( within previous year ) pharmacological dos thyroid hormone ( cause decline thyroid stimulate hormone normal ) calcium supplementation > 1200 mg/d ( within precede 3 month ) bisphosphonates ( within past 3 yr ) denosumab estrogen ( E ) therapy within past year treatment selective E receptor modulator within past year teriparatide within past yr antihypertensive therapy Clinical history osteoporotic fracture ( vertebral , hip , distal forearm Recent ( within past 6 month ) fracture Serum 25hydroxyvitamin D level < 20 ng/ml Resting blood pressure > 140/90 mm Hg hypotension ( systolic blood pressure < 110 mm Hg ) , heart rate < 60 bpm History asthma
